hpi: Taylor Reed is a 25-year-old female presenting with a 2-day history of burning pain during urination in the genital area. Severity is 2-3/10, sharp and burning in character, occurring only at the end of urination with no radiation. Blood first noticed today on toilet tissue. She drank extra water last night and has tried nothing else. LMP was 10 days ago with a negative OTC pregnancy test. She denies fever, chills, flank pain, nausea, vomiting, vaginal discharge, or vaginal bleeding.

conversation.content: Hello, my name is Sarah and I am a DNP student. Can you confirm your name and date of birth?
Hi, I'm Taylor Reed, born February 14, 2001.
Thank you Taylor. May I call you by your first name?
Yes that's fine.
What brings you in today?
I have been having burning when I urinate.
I'm sorry to hear that, I appreciate you sharing that with me. When did this start?
It started about 2 days ago.
Where is the burning located? Any radiation or spread?
Just in my genital area, no radiation.
How would you describe the character — burning, sharp? And how severe on a scale of 0 to 10?
It's sharp and burning, about 2-3/10.
Is it constant or intermittent? Does it happen at the end of urination?
Intermittent, mostly at the end of urination.
Have you tried anything — drinking more water or any treatments?
I drank extra water last night, nothing else tried.
Do you have urinary frequency or urgency — are you going more often?
Yes, I have frequency, going more often than usual.
Any blood in urine or hematuria?
Yes, I noticed some blood on the tissue today.
Any fever or chills?
No fever, no chills.
Any flank pain or back pain?
No flank pain, no back pain.
Any nausea or vomiting?
No nausea, no vomiting.
Any vaginal discharge or vaginal bleeding?
No vaginal discharge or vaginal bleeding.
What was your last menstrual period? Could you be pregnant?
LMP was 10 days ago, I took a pregnancy test and it was negative.
Do you have any allergies? And what medications are you taking including OTC and supplements?
No allergies, no medications.
Are you sexually active? Any new partners or STI concerns? Are you using condoms or birth control?
Yes, sexually active with one partner for 2 months, using condoms.
Have you had a prior UTI before? Any past medical history or surgical history?
Yes, I had a UTI about a year ago. No other medical history, no surgeries.
Any relevant family history — does anything run in your family?
Parents are healthy, one younger brother, nothing notable.
Do you drink alcohol? Do you smoke tobacco or vape? Any drug use?
I drink occasionally, no tobacco, tried marijuana once over a year ago.
Tell me about your living situation and support system — what is your occupation?
I am a college student, live with roommates, good support system.
Any recent annual exam or immunizations?
Had a physical last year, vaccines are up to date.
How is your hydration — how much water are you drinking? Any caffeine intake?
I have not been drinking enough water lately. I drink coffee regularly.
I would like to do a focused exam. Any abdominal pain? Any CVA tenderness or back pain on percussion?
No abdominal pain, no CVA tenderness.
Based on your symptoms I believe you have a urinary tract infection — UTI, also called cystitis.
Okay, what do I do?

I will prescribe an antibiotic — nitrofurantoin. I would also like to order a urinalysis now, and if symptoms persist we can follow up with a urine culture. Please follow up with me in one week. If you develop fever, flank pain, vomiting, or worsening symptoms please go to urgent care or the emergency room.
Okay, thank you.
Make sure to drink plenty of water and push fluids. Also remember to wipe front to back. And after intercourse, make sure to urinate after sex to help prevent future UTIs.
That is very helpful, thank you so much.
